lines.text: Once in a purple moon, there is a special young witch who shines above the rest. Often she goes unnoticed, because she is always out of step. I have seen this girl trying to fly. Oh yes, I have. I've seen her at play and how her friends treated her. A true witch isn't always one who comes out on top of the tests. A true witch has witchcraft in her at all times, and this is what you have, Mildred Hubble. And so, Ms. Cackle, I ask you to make the rest of the day a half-holiday.
Now, Mildred, have you made any plans for this unexpected holiday?
No, Grand Wizard. I suppose I'd better practice my flying.
Would you like to practice with me?
With you?
Oh, absolutely.
Maud?
Go to sleep, Mildred.
I can't.
Why not?
I'm afraid of the dark.

[after asking Mildred if she knew how to play Terror Tag]
I choose... Bubbles.
Donna's arrived. She'll be a hundred and thirty six next month and she still acts like a teenager.
Shut up Delilah!
Shut up Delilah.
[last lines]
You see? You're not the worst witch anymore.
[after Mildred gets in trouble for escaping the school]

[laughs, singsong]
Mildred's going to get it right between the eyes.
What are you so happy about?
My broomstick - it did the trick.
What are you talking about.
She just couldn't handle it. Oh, never mind, just forget about it.

[suspiciously]
Handle what?

[irritated, the other girls gather around]
Never mind.

[angrily points at her]
You put a curse on her!
Don't be ridiculous.
It was you all along! You're always picking on Mildred, but this time, you've ruined it for all of us!
I don't know what you're talking about!

[furiously]
You evil-hearted, mean-spirited, no-good, rotten PIG!
You sure you know how to play Terror Tag?
Everyone knows how to play Terror Tag.
You're not everyone.

[while Maud and Mildred are playing Terror Tag]
I was only practicing Dum-Dum!

[playing his tambourine]
Has anybody seen my tambourine?
[repeated line]
MILDRED HUBBLE!
You should be finished by now girls. A laughter potion should be made quickly, in case it's needed in an emergency.
Miss Hardbroom hates me.
Miss Hardbroom hates everyone.
Imagine kissing that.
Imagine kissing HB.

[appearing from nowhere]
Is that so?
[the girls shriek]
I would think, after your disastrous performances today, you should be hardly be spreading disgusting gossip about matters which do not concern you.
Yes Miss Hardbroom.
And you had both pay much more attention to your studies, if you ever hope to graduate from this institution. The finest's witching academy in the world.
Yes Miss Hardbroom!
Now go back to bed.
[they dive under the covers]
Pleasant nightmares.
[Mildred and Maud have accidentally made themselves invisble]
Have you any idea what you did wrong Mildred?
It was my fault Miss Hardbroom.
No, it was my fault Miss Hardbroom.
I don't care whose fault it was. Sit still until you reappear!
Yes Miss Hardbroom.
You Mildred Hubble, will go straight to Miss Cackle's office and explain exactly why you failed your potions test so miserably!
[claps her hands]
Class dismissed.
I've been quite hard on you, Mildred. But I wouldn't have troubled if I hadn't always thought you had potential.
So Mildred, what can I do for you?
Miss Hardbroom sent me.
Oh dear. What happened this time?
Go to sleep.
I can't.
Why not?
I'm afraid of the dark.
How dare you say I smell?
No textbooks Maud! Either you know it or you don't. You can't fake a potion.
